title: At Least ‘Quid Pro Quo’ Has Revived Latin
text:
These are thrilling times for those of us who took Latin in school. The ubiquitous use of the term quid pro quo (essentially, “something for something”) to describe the president’s controversial offer to the Ukrainian government has gotten classicists excited in a way not seen since the heady days of the 1980s, when the word qua was much in use. (It means “as,” as in, “She’s a great singer qua singer, but she’s too old to play Goldilocks.”)

As if the quid pro quo craze were not exciting enough, Brad Pitt just starred in a...
description: But have we attained the ‘sine qua non’ or reached the ‘ne plus ultra’?
